title: Friends’ Courteney Cox baffled by Sara Foster’s epic Monica Geller Halloween costume
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Sara Foster might have just won Halloween by recruiting her two daughters to become the ladies of Friends – even if Courteney Cox wasn’t quite sure who she was supposed to be.

The trio grabbed coffees and a fake guitar and lined up on a mock-up of the iconic sofa to look like they were having a chat at our beloved Central Perk.

(Just in case you weren’t sure though, Sara had a Central Perk logo to be extra clear.)

Advertisement

Sara dressed up like Monica, while young Josie became Phoebe and Valentina was Rachel.

Commenting on the picture, Courteney, who played Monica on the show, sent them applause emojis and joked: ‘Rachel and Phoebe. You…Who the hell are you?’

‘I’m MONICA!!!,’ Sara responded. ‘You clearly have never seen FRIENDS.’

Katharine McPhee also joked that Sara’s dad David, Katharine’s husband, was out of shot dressed like Gunther.

Sara Foster recruited her kids for the ultimate Friends costume (Picture: Instagram)

We’re here for this amazing group costume – which came complete with Josie giving her own rendition of Phoebe’s classic song, Smelly Cat, as her sister stood next to her rolling her eyes.

‘The one where the mom forces her kids to wear a family costume of her choice,’ Sara added.

‘They made me dress up as Elsa last year so I don’t feel bad about this at all.’

Fair trade, Sara. Congrats on winning Halloween you guys!

Friends isn’t Friends without Central Perk (Picture: NBC)

In the meantime, we’re living in hope that the real Monica Geller could return after Jennifer Aniston admits that the original gang are ‘working on something’.

The real Courteney is currently super busy living her best life hanging out with famous pals and getting in hot tubs with David Beckham and the cast of Modern Family.

But she still has time for the gang, and threw a party with the original six recently to celebrate the 25th anniversary of the show’s launch.
